cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 150 mi ENE of Great Abaco Island
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-southwest toward the NW Bahamas and Florida east coast, then turning northwest and north across the Florida Peninsula into southern Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (between Boca Raton and the Flagler/Volusia County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: North Palm Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA (storm-surge and tropical-storm warnings south of the port)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Georgia and South Carolina coastline likely to experience tropical-storm conditions, storm surge, heavy surf and rain
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (NHC forecast 2–4 ft for Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–63 kt) possible Thursday into early Friday, peak chance 16%
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible around high tide, especially north of the Savannah River entrance
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain Thursday–Friday with localized higher amounts
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes late Wednesday night through Friday; dangerous surf and rip currents
